basics.name: Darius DeSpain
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Engineering in the College of Engineering and am currently a cadet at the Air Force ROTC unit, Detachment 175, at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2020. My goal is to use my passion for technology to help people, specifically by becoming a cyber leader in the United States Air Force.

work.summary: Training to become an officer in  the United States Air Force
highlights: Develop plans and execute training for new cadets
Hone professionalism in preparation of becoming an officer
Troubleshoot software, hardware and networking issues over the phone
Answer phone and email responses to the ITS Help Desk
Assists with operations monitoring in the IT Operations Center
National Conclave HQ Chief of Protocol, Nov 2018 - Present
Area-Region Conclave 11 Vice Commander, Apr 2018 - Oct 2018
National Chief of Protocol Executive Officer, Oct 2017 - Apr 2018
Area-Region 11 Chief of Protocol, Apr 2017 - Oct 2017

awards.title: AFROTC Type 1 Commander In-College Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded to cadets who show the greatest officer potential and success in their academic career.

awards.title: Chancellor's Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship Awarded to incoming freshmen from Hawaii based upon high school GPA, test scores, and extra curricular activities.
